conclusion: Identify the relevant formula for the induced EMF using Faraday's law of induction.
The induced EMF formula is \( \mathcal{E} = N \cdot B \cdot A \cdot \left| \frac{d\theta}{dt} \right| \).
Determine the area of the coil as \( A = L^2 \).
The coil rotates at a constant angular velocity \( \omega \).
Substitute known values into the EMF formula to get \( \mathcal{E} = N \cdot B \cdot L^2 \cdot \omega \).
For a sinusoidal alternating current, the effective value is given by \( \mathcal{E}_{\text{eff}} = \frac{\mathcal{E}_{\text{max}}}{\sqrt{2}} \).
Calculate \( \mathcal{E}_{\text{max}} = N \cdot B \cdot L^2 \cdot \omega \) and thus \( \mathcal{E}_{\text{eff}} = \frac{N \cdot B \cdot L^2 \cdot \omega}{\sqrt{2}} \).
The effective value of the induced electromotive force in the coil is \( \boxed{\frac{N \cdot B \cdot L^2 \cdot \omega}{\sqrt{2}}} \).
